keyword: calories in one cup of flour
title: Calories in One Cup of Flour
meta_description: Discover calories in one cup of flour, including carbs, protein, fat, per-100 g breakdown, and simple tweaks for baking variations.
h1: Calories in One Cup of Flour
assumptions: All-purpose white flour, unsifted (≈125 g per cup), no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by flour type (e.g., whole wheat, bread), brand, sifting, packing density, and measurement. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of all-purpose flour provides about 455 calories and 13 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Sifted all-purpose flour (≈120 g per cup)
Add 1 tsp baking powder (for self-rising style)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one cup of all-purpose flour?
faqs.a: Approximately 455 calories for one unsifted cup (125 g).

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a cup of flour?
faqs.a: About 95 g of carbohydrates, mostly from starch, with 3.4 g fiber.
Yes, one cup has around 13 g protein, good for baking structure.

faqs.q: How does sifting affect calories in flour?
faqs.a: Sifting makes it lighter (≈120 g per cup), reducing calories to about 437.

faqs.q: What's the difference in calories for whole wheat flour?
faqs.a: One cup of whole wheat flour has about 410 calories, with more fiber.
